trans-unit.source: How to define a custom API in a JavaScript backend mobile service | Azure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: How to define a custom API in a JavaScript backend mobile service | Azure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Learn how to define a custom API endpoint in a JavaScript backend mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to define a custom API endpoint in a JavaScript backend mobile service.

trans-unit.source: How to: define a custom API endpoint in a JavaScript backend mobile service
trans-unit.target: How to: define a custom API endpoint in a JavaScript backend mobile service

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to define a custom API endpoint in a JavaScript backend mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to define a custom API endpoint in a JavaScript backend mobile service.

trans-unit.source: A custom API lets you define custom endpoints with server functionality, but it does not map to a database insert, update, delete, or read operation.
trans-unit.target: A custom API lets you define custom endpoints with server functionality, but it does not map to a database insert, update, delete, or read operation.

trans-unit.source: By using a custom API, you have more control over messaging, including HTTP headers and body format.
trans-unit.target: By using a custom API, you have more control over messaging, including HTTP headers and body format.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to invoke a custom API in your app using a Mobile Services client library, see [Call a custom API](mobile-services-windows-dotnet-how-to-use-client-library.md#custom-api) in the client SDK reference.
trans-unit.target: For information on how to invoke a custom API in your app using a Mobile Services client library, see [Call a custom API](mobile-services-windows-dotnet-how-to-use-client-library.md#custom-api) in the client SDK reference.
